settings.title: Product Details
settings.content:
• This item is MADE-TO-ORDER. Production times vary from 2-4 weeks depending on shop workload. Please check current lead times HERE.
  • Finish options shown below.
  • Mounting Plate - 3/16" thick and 5" x your chosen width.
  • 5/16" x 1" slotted mounting holes.
  • Felt pads or leveling feet, details below.
  • Made with 14 gauge 1x3 American hot-rolled tube steel
  • Shipping cost calculated at checkout.
  • Handmade in the USA.

settings.title: Choosing Dimensions
settings.content:
HEIGHT

  • Remember to subtract the thickness of your tabletop when selecting your leg or base height.
  • Example: if your tabletop is 2" thick and you are building a 30" tall dining table, you will choose 28" for the height of your table legs or base.
  • Standard finished heights below, subtract table top thickness to calculate proper leg or base height.
Coffee height 14"-18"
Bench Height 18"-20"
Dining Height 29"-30"
Counter Height 34"-36"
Bar Height 42"-44"

WIDTH

  • The proper width of your legs or base can vary depending on preference and use. A safe rule of thumb is for the legs to be at least two-thirds of the width of the tabletop
  • Example: if your tabletop is 36" wide, the legs should be 24" or wider, depending on aesthetic preference. Please contact us if you need help with sizing.

settings.custom_liquid:
Product Details +
  • This item is MADE-TO-ORDER. Production times vary from 2-4 weeks depending on shop workload. Please check current lead times HERE.
  • Finish options shown belown.
  • Mounting Plate - Flat Plate or Pro Plate, details below
  • Plastic glides or leveling feet, details below
  • 14 gauge 2x2 American hot-rolled tube steel
  • Shipping cost calculated at checkout.
  • Handmade in the USA.
Choosing Dimensions +

HEIGHT

  • Remember to subtract the thickness of your table top when selecting your leg or base height.
  • For example, if your tabletop is 2" thick and you are building a 30"tall dining table, you will choose 28" for the height of your table legs or base.
  • Standard finished heights below, subtract table top thickness to calculate proper leg or base height.
Coffee height 14"-18"
Bench Height 18"-20"
Dining Height 29"-30"
Counter Height 34"-36"
Bar Height 42"-44"

WIDTH

  • The proper width of your legs or base can vary depending on preference and use. A safe rule of thumb is for the legs to be at least two-thirds of the width of the tabletop
  • For instance, if your tabletop is 36" wide, the legs should be 24" or wider, depending on aesthetic preference. Please contact us if you need help with sizing to optimize stability and seating room.

custom_css: .thumbnails {width: fit-content; margin: 0 auto; display: block; @media only screen and (max-width: 768px) {width: unset; margin: unset; display: grid; grid-template-columns: auto auto auto; }}

settings.custom_liquid: Finish Options

custom_css: .home-section.content-area {width: 100%; max-width: initial; padding: 5% 10%; margin: 32px 0; background-color: #102b53; @media only screen and (max-width: 768px) {padding-left: 2%; padding-right: 2%; }}

settings.custom_liquid:
Mounting Plates

Flat Plate

3/16” thick, 5” x your chosen width. Our standard Flat Plate comes with 5/16” x 1” slotted holes to accommodate seasonal wood movement. It is a solid solution for attaching the legs or base to your tabletop.

Pro Plate

With added tube steel reinforcement and 5/16” x 1” slotted holes, our Pro Plate serves two purposes. First, it acts as a substitute for channel steel inserts by preventing wood movement, cupping, and warping. This reduces cost and labor time. Second, it eliminates end-to-end, lateral shake in the table by maximizing the rigidity of the mounting plate. If rock solid stability is the goal, the Pro Plate is the way to go.
